Title: Russian oligarch Deripaska's assets worth UAH 2.11 bln seized in ...
Description: Based on materials from the Security Service of Ukraine, the court has seized a large batch of industrial products and raw materials owned by sanctioned Russian oligarch Oleg Deripaska.

Title: Sybiha: In global competition age, EU must be competitive, it nee...
Description: In an age of global competition, the EU must be competitive, and for this, it needs Ukraine with its army, technology, and people, Ukrainian Foreign Minister Andriy Sybiha has said.

Title: Ukrainian, Croatian PMs agree to hold joint govt meetings in 2025
Description: Ukrainian Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal has agreed with Croatian Prime Minister Andrej Plenkovic to hold joint meetings of the governments of both countries in 2025.

Title: Restoration of Pediatric Cardiology Center affected by Russian at...
Description: The Ukrainian Red Cross, together with its partners, continues to restore the state-owned Scientific and Practical Medical Center for Pediatric Cardiology and Cardiac Surgery of the Ministry of Health of Ukraine, which was damaged during the Russian missile attack on Kyiv on July 8, 2024.

Title: Ukraine, Croatia discuss establishing joint task force to monitor...
Description: Ukrainian Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal and his Croatian counterpart Andrej Plenkovic met to discuss the creation of a joint task force to monitor the illegal activities of Russia's shadow fleet.

Title: Tochytsky, UNESCO Director-General address lack of restorers, spe...
Description: Mykola Tochytsky, the Minister of Culture and Strategic Communications of Ukraine, met with UNESCO Director-General Audrey Azoulay to discuss solutions for addressing the shortage of restorers and specialists needed for evacuation of cultural heritage.

Title: Kyiv parks shrink by 800 ha in ten years – ecologist
Description: KYIV. Jan 29 (Interfax-Ukraine) – Director of Kyiv Ecological and Cultural Center Volodymyr Boreiko said that, according to a survey conducted by the center, Kyiv parks have shrunk by 800 hectares over the past decade, and Kyiv City Council failed to establish a single nature reserve in 2024.

Title: Croatia preparing new package of military-technical assistance fo...
Description: Croatia is preparing a new package of military-technical assistance for Ukraine, Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal said.

Title: Early booking of tours to Greece by bus to the sea with ANEX Tour...
Zelenskyy honors memory of Heroes of Kruty
Description: President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyy took part in a flower-laying ceremony at the memorial cross to the Heroes of Kruty at Askold's grave in Kyiv.

Title: Finland develops extended-range drone for Ukraine
Description: The Finnish company Insta will present an extended-range SteelEagle drone developed for Ukraine jointly with Ukrainian specialists at the SecD Day event opening in Helsinki on Wednesday.

Title: Number of EU countries ready to build fortifications in Ukraine, ...
Description: The European Union is preparing a new package of sanctions against Russia for the third anniversary of the full-scale invasion of Ukraine, and a number of member states have expressed their willingness to participate in the construction of fortifications, in particular in Dnipropetrovsk region, said MP of Ukraine, leader of the European Solidarity party Petro Poroshenko, who is currently on a visit to Brussels.

Title: Defense forces hit ammunition depot, seven areas of invaders’ con...
Description: Over the past day, missile forces and artillery of the Defense Forces have carried out one attack on an ammunition depot, seven on areas where personnel and military equipment are concentrated, two on command posts and two on enemy artillery systems.

Title: Some 193 military clashes recorded during past day - General Staf...
Description: Over the past day, 193 military clashes have been recorded. This is reported by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on Telegram in operational information on the Russian invasion as of 8:00 on Wednesday.

Title: PACE resolution on threat from PMCs is powerful signal for all co...
Description: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine welcomes the adoption of the resolution by the Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe (PACE), which raises urgent issues regarding the activities of private military and security companies (PMSCs), mercenaries, and other non-State actors involved in military operations, the Ukrainian Foreign Ministry said on Tuesday.

Title: There’re concrete details on formation of corps in AFU – Zelensky...
Description: On Tuesday, President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyy held a meeting of the Supreme Commander's Staff Headquarters, among the issues that were considered was the formation of corps in the Armed Forces of Ukraine.

Title: US military aid for Ukraine continues - Center for Countering Dis...
Description: Head of the NSDC's Center for Countering Disinformation, Andriy Kovalenko, denied information about the alleged termination of military assistance to Ukraine from the United States.

Title: Russia intensifying its campaign of sabotage against European NAT...
Description: NATO acknowledged that Russia is escalating a sabotage and destabilization campaign against European NATO member states to deter further military assistance to Ukraine, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) notes in an analytical report for January 28.

Title: URCS volunteers eliminate consequences of Russian missile attack ...
Description: The Ukrainian Red Cross Society (URCS) emergency response team in Mykolaiv region worked at the site of a missile attack inflicted on Tuesday.

Title: UNESCO Cultural Hub opened in Lviv
Description: The UNESCO Cultural Hub has been opened in Lviv, the Ministry of Culture and Strategic Communications of Ukraine has said.

Title: Fico chooses Moscow – Zelenskyy responds to accusations of Slovak...
Description: Robert Fico chooses Moscow instead of America and other partners who can provide his country with gas on commercial terms, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy replied on Telegram to the attacks of the Slovak Prime Minister.

Title: Zelenskyy orders report on halted U.S. support programs
Description: President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyy has instructed officials to provide a report on humanitarian U.S. support programs that are currently suspended.

Title: Two women die as result of missile strike on Mykolaiv - Emergency...
Missile attack hits private enterprise in Mykolaiv
Description: As a result of a missile attack by Russian occupation forces on Tuesday, a private enterprise in Mykolaiv was hit, the city's mayor Oleksandr Senkevych said.

Title: Over 100 Donetsk residents resettled in safer areas in Jan – auth...
Description: Mandatory evacuation from the frontline areas of Donetsk region continues, more than 100 Donetsk residents were evacuated and resettled in safer areas in January, Head of Donetsk Regional Military Administration Vadym Filashkin said on Tuesday.

Title: Ukrainian, Spanish FMs sign agreement in Lviv to support Ukrainia...
Description: Foreign Ministers Andriy Sybiha and José Manuel Albares signed an agreement in Lviv on cooperation between Ukraine and Spain in education, which will help improve the quality standards of teaching Spanish in Ukrainian schools, as well as preserve and support schools with the study of the Spanish language and culture, where Spanish is taught as the first or second foreign language.

Title: Anti-Corruption Bureau confirms investigation against Ukrainian D...
Description: The National Anti-Corruption Bureau of Ukraine (NABU) has confirmed that it registered an investigation based on a report from the Anti-Corruption Action Centre (AntAC) regarding alleged criminal misconduct by Ukrainian Defense Minister Rustem Umerov, as outlined under Part 2 of Article 364 of the Ukrainian Criminal Code (abuse of power or official position).

Title: Three Ministers, UNESCO Director General arrive in Lviv for openi...
Description: The Ministers of Foreign Affairs of Spain and Ukraine, José Manuel Albares and Andriy Sybiha, UNESCO Director General Audrey Azoulay, and Minister of Culture of Ukraine Mykola Tochytsky, arrived in Lviv to participate in the opening of a cultural hub in the city, Mayor Andriy Sadovy said.

Title: URCS helps victims of Russian attack on Odesa
Description: The Ukrainian Red Cross Society (URCS) helped victims of the Russian morning massive drone attack on Odesa.

Title: Zelenskyy, Israeli PM discuss maintaining partnership relations w...
Description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy held a conversation with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, during which the parties discussed current bilateral issues and agreed to continue close contact in the future.

Title: Olenivka colony management deliberately committed actions that le...
Description: The management of the Olenivka penal colony together with representatives of the Federal Penitentiary Service of the Russian Federation deliberately committed actions that led to even greater losses of Ukrainian servicemen during the tragedy, the prosecutor of the 18th Department of the Prosecutor General's Office (PGO), Dmytro Martsyn, has said.

Title: PACE calls to reform UN Security Council – MP
Description: The Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe (PACE) has called for a reform of the UN Security Council, a member of the permanent delegation of the Verkhovna Rada to PACE, Yevhenia Kravchuk (Servant of the People faction) said Tuesday.

Title: Report on militarization of Ukrainian children in occupied territ...
Description: A presentation of the analytical report 'Militarization of Ukrainian children in the temporarily occupied territories of Ukraine' took place in Kyiv with the participation of Head of the Center for Countering Disinformation (CCD) Andriy Kovalenko and Advisor to the Head of the Office of the President of Ukraine and Operations Director of the Bring Kids Back UA initiative Daria Zarivna, as well as with the participation of the CCD's management.

Title: Ukraine shares PACE's call for reform of key intl institutions, i...
Description: Ukraine shares the call of the Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe (PACE) for the reform of key international institutions, in particular the UN Security Council (UNSC), in order to increase their effectiveness and ability to solve global crises.

Title: Pokrovsk direction remains hottest on front - Khortytsia group of...
Description: Heavy defensive battles are continuing in Pokrovsk direction of the front, the press service of the Khortytsia operational-strategic group of forces reports.

Title: Ukraine to receive Mirage 2000-5 fighter jets from France before ...
Description: France will transfer Mirage 2000-5 fighter jets to Ukraine by the end of the first quarter of 2025, French Foreign Minister Jean-Noel Barrot said.

Title: Ukraine recaptures lost positions near Toretsk, Russia advances n...
Description: Ukrainian forces recently recaptured lost positions near Toretsk, meanwhile Russian forces advanced near Toretsk, Chasiv Yar, and Kurakhove, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) said in the Russian offensive campaign assessment as of January 27.

Title: Poland makes decision to limit attempts to block Polish-Ukrainian...
Description: The Polish government has added border checkpoints to the list of critical infrastructure in order to limit possible attempts to block the Polish-Ukrainian border in the future, said Pawel Kowal, Chairman of the Council for Cooperation with Ukraine and the Foreign Affairs Committee of the Polish Sejm.

Title: Defense forces destroy 65 enemy drones overnight
Description: On the night of January 28, the Russian occupation forces launched 100 Shahed kamikaze drones and simulator drones to attack the territory of Ukraine, the Ukrainian Air Force command has reported on Tuesday morning.

Title: Metinvest advocates for predictable tax, tariff policy, which wil...
Description: Mining and metallurgical group Metinvest considers it necessary to implement predictable tax and tariff policy in Ukraine, which will help attract foreign investment, otherwise large players will not invest in domestic enterprises.

Title: USA suspends U4U program for Ukrainian refugees
Description: The U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) has announced the suspension of the program for Ukrainians fleeing to the United States, known as Uniting for Ukraine (U4U), Voice of America reported on Tuesday.

Title: No grounds currently for applying sanctions against Portnov – Shm...
Description: Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal, in response to the petition, states that there is currently no information on the existence of grounds for applying sanctions to former Deputy Head of the Presidential Administration Andriy Portnov.

Title: Russian army shells nine communities in Sumy region, casualties a...
Description: The Russian occupation forces shelled nine communities in Sumy region during the past 24 hours, causing damage and injuring five people, the regional military administration has said on Tuesday morning.

Title: Infrastructure facility damaged in Russian drone attack on Uman –...
Description: An infrastructure facility was damaged as a result of a Russian drone attack on Uman, Cherkasy region, last night, the city mayor, Iryna Pletniova, has said Tuesday morning.

Title: Zaporizhstal masters production of six new types of products in 2...
Description: Zaporizhstal in 2024 began producing six new types of sheet and rolled products, which are in demand in the construction industry, car building and the hardware segment.

Title: Issue of confiscating $300 bln in Russian assets most important i...
Description: The confiscation of $300 billion in frozen Russian assets will give Ukraine the opportunity to win, this is the most important issue for the country today, this opinion was expressed by founder and CEO of Hermitage Capital Management Bill Browder in a discussion at the Ukrainian House on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum in Davos.

Title: Israeli Ambassador denies plans to send Russian weapons seized in...
Description: Israeli Ambassador to Ukraine Michael Brodsky denies any intention to transfer Russian weapons seized in Lebanon to Ukraine, Radio Liberty reported Monday, January 27.

Title: Zelenskyy: Anyone who sows hatred destined to lose, anyone who sa...
Description: In Poland, President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyy, together with world leaders and former prisoners of Auschwitz-Birkenau Nazi concentration camp, took part in events dedicated to the 80th anniversary of its liberation, the Office of the President of Ukraine said.

Title: Nuclear weapons should've been changed for real security guarante...
Description: President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyy described Ukraine giving up its nuclear arsenal as 'illogical,' adding that it should have been exchanged for real security guarantees.

Title: Justice Ministry files lawsuit with HACC to recover network of ga...
Description: On January 27, the Ministry of Justice of Ukraine filed lawsuits with the High Anti-Corruption Court (HACC) to apply a sanction in the form of asset recovery for the benefit of the state against PJSC Tatneft named after V.D. Shashin (Tatneft), Deputy Minister Inna Bohatykh reported on Facebook.

Title: Zelenskyy, Macron discuss forms of security guarantees for Ukrain...
Description: President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyy met with his French counterpart Emmanuel Macron in Poland following the ceremony marking the 80th anniversary of the liberation of Auschwitz-Birkenau Nazi concentration camp on Monday, January 27. They discussed continued support for Ukraine and possible forms of security guarantees for Ukraine.

Title: Khortytsia group: Main direction of occupiers' efforts remains Po...
Description: Ukrainian forces maintain positions in the cities of Toretsk and Chasiv Yar, as well as in Velyka Novosilka, are fighting in the streets, the main direction of the occupiers' efforts remains Pokrovsk, which they are trying to bypass from the west, Spokesman for the Khortytsia operational-strategic group of forces Viktor Trehubov said.

Title: Ukraine's accession to EU poses serious risk for farmers, we not ...
Description: Hungary's main task remains to protect the interests of Hungarian farmers from Ukrainian agricultural products, Hungarian Agriculture Minister István Nagy said after a meeting of the EU Agriculture and Fisheries Council in Brussels on Monday.

Title: Zelenskyy believes Israel starts to change its position on milita...
Description: Ukraine has not received military aid from Israel, which wanted to be in balance between Russia and Ukraine, but is now beginning to change its position, according to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

Title: Zelenskyy: If half army goes home tomorrow, Putin to kill us all
Description: Martial law requires the mobilization of people and all resources, so we need to force Russia to end this war faster, if half the army goes home tomorrow, Vladimir Putin will kill all Ukrainians, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy believes.

Title: Education Ministry on Kyiv-Mohyla Academy: Ministry is not sellin...
Description: Deputy Minister of Education and Science Mykhailo Vinnytsky says Ukrainian legislation does not provide for the possibility of privatizing state universities, and changes to the legislation are not currently being considered.

Title: Constitutional Court's three judges complete their nine-year term...
Description: Three judges of the Constitutional Court of Ukraine have completed their nine-year term in office, from now on the court will work as a composition of 11 judges and will require the earliest possible filling of vacancies, the court's Communications and Legal Monitoring Department said.

Title: EU should resolve issue of liberalizing trade with Ukraine consid...
Description: The Agriculture and Fisheries Council of the European Union will have to consider in the next six months the regulation on Ukrainian agricultural imports, which expires in June, taking into account the interests of European farmers, said Hungarian Agriculture Minister Istvan Nagy.

Title: Tractor driver killed in enemy drone attack on Kherson region
Description: A tractor driver was killed as a result of a Russian drone attack on Kherson region on Monday, the head of the regional military administration, Oleksandr Prokudin, has said.

Title: Ukraine pins hopes for just end to war on Trump – Poroshenko on C...
Sybiha thanks EU for decision to extend sanctions against Russia
Description: Minister of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine Andriy Sybiha thanked EU colleagues for their important decision to extend sanctions against Ukraine.

Title: General Staff reports 37 combat clashes, incl ten ongoing, on Pok...
Description: Since the beginning of the day and as of 16:00, 82 combat clashes were recorded along the entire front line, including 37 on the Pokrovsk axis, ten of which are still ongoing, the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine (AFU) has said on Monday.

Title: Costa encourages Zelenskyy to continue working on Ukraine's EU ac...
Description: President of the European Council Antonio Costa met with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Poland and assured him of the EU's steadfast support.

Title: CANCELLATION: Press briefing 'Improving palliative care at primar...
Description: The press briefing on the subject: 'Improving palliative care at primary health care level,' on the results of the program 'Strengthening the capacity of primary health care institutions to provide palliative care in Chernihiv, Sumy and Dnipropetrovsk regions,' implemented within the project Support for Health Care Reform, previously announced for 15.00 on Wednesday, January 29, at the press center of the Interfax-Ukraine News Agency has been cancelled. For additional information, call: (093) 876 5890 (Hanna Kotenko).

Title: Open new horizons for your business at the Mind Export Summit 202...
Description: On 13 February, the largest conference for Ukrainian entrepreneurs on entering foreign markets, finding partners, step-by-step strategies and tactical solutions - Mind Export Summit 2025 - will take place in Kiyv for two days.

Title: Civilian hospitalized after enemy attack on Kharkiv region
Description: The Russian occupation army attacked the village of Kondrashivka in the Kupyansk district, Kharkiv region, on Monday, the head of the regional military administration, Oleh Synehubov, has said.

Title: Four people injured as occupiers attack Stepnohirsk
Description: Four people were injured as a result of a Russian attack on the town of Stepnohirsk in the Vasylivka district, Zaporizhia region, on Monday, the head of the regional military administration, Ivan Fedorov, has said.

Title: Ukrtsukor announces TOP-5 sugar producers of Ukraine in 2024 seas...
Description: Ukrainian sugar producers set a historical record for sugar exports in 2024, sending 746,300 tonnes of this product to foreign markets worth UAH 419 million, the National Association of Sugar Producers of Ukraine (Ukrtsukor) announced the top-five sugar producers in the 2024 season, the press service of the association reported on Facebook.

Title: EU extends economic sanctions against Russia for further six mont...
Description: The European Union has extended its restrictive measures in view of the Russian Federation's continuing actions destabilizing the situation in Ukraine for a further six months, until July 31, 2025, the European Council announced on Monday.

Title: EU provides energy security guarantees to Hungary – FM
Description: The European Union has provided energy security guarantees to Hungary, Hungarian Foreign Minister Peter Szijjarto said.

Title: Russian troops lose 1,430 military in past day – General Staff
Description: During the day, the defense forces eliminated 1,430 occupiers, three tanks, 12 armored vehicles, 16 artillery systems, 74 UAVs, and 60 units of cars and special equipment units, the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine reported on Facebook on Monday morning.

Title: EU approves extension of sanctions for Russia
Description: The EU High Representative for Foreign Affairs and Security Policy Kaja Kallas reports that the foreign ministers of the EU member states have again decided to extend sanctions against Russia.

Title: Zelenskyy arrives in Poland to participate in events dedicated to...
Description: President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyy has arrived in Poland, where he will take part in events marking the 80th anniversary of the liberation of Auschwitz, presidential spokesman Serhiy Nykyforov told reporters.

Title: We maintain buffer zone in Kursk region to secure Sumy and Kharki...
Description: President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said that Ukraine maintains a 'buffer zone' in Kursk region to protect Sumy and Kharkiv from the attacks of Russian troops.

Title: Head of Khortytsia strategic group Hnatov appointed as dpty chief...
Description: President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyy has appointed Major General of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine Andriy Hnatov to the post of Deputy Chief of the General Staff.

Title: Zelenskyy: Russians kill about 20,000 people in Mariupol
Description: It is currently impossible to determine the real death toll in Mariupol, according to available information, Russians killed about 20,000 people in the city, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said.

Title: Ukraine plans to open refugee return center in Czech Republic
Description: Ukraine is planning to open refugee return centers in several European countries, the Denik N publication reported on Friday.

Title: Fifty-seven out of 104 enemy drones shot down at night, 39 lost f...
Description: On Monday night, Russian invaders attacked Ukraine with 104 Shahed-type unmanned aerial vehicles and various types of imitation drones, 57 of them were shot down, and 39 enemy imitation drones were lost without negative consequences, according to the Telegram channel of the Air Force of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.

Title: Defense forces hit warehouses with attack UAVs in Orel region
Description: The defense forces attacked the warehouses of the shock UAVs of the Russian occupiers in Orel region of the Russian Federation, more than 200 shaheds were neutralized, the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine reports.

Title: Zelenskyy orders commander of ground forces Drapatyi to lead Khor...
Description: President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyy has ordered the commander of the ground forces Mykhailo Drapatyi to lead the operational-strategic group of troops Khortytsia.

Title: USAID-funded civil aid projects in Ukraine suspended – media
Description: The U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID) has been ordered to suspend funding for projects being implemented in Ukraine, Reuters reports, citing a source in the agency.

Title: PM: Ukraine presents Moldova with proposals to resolve energy cri...
Description: Counteracting hybrid threats from Russia and developing economic partnership were discussed by Ukrainian Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal and Moldovan President Maia Sandu during a meeting in Kyiv on Saturday.

Title: Putin signals he not interested in peace without his demands bein...
Description: Vladimir Putin continues to signal to both his domestic and global audiences that he is not interested in peace without his full demands being met and remains committed to Ukraine's complete capitulation, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) said.

Title: Zelenskyy signs decree banning talks in Oct 2022 to stop separati...
Description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy signed a decree of the National Security and Defense Council in October 2022 banning any negotiations with Russia in order to stop separatism in Ukraine.

Title: Sandu hopes 2025 to bring just peace
Description: Moldova has assured of support for the territorial integrity and sovereignty of Ukraine, and also hopes that 2025 will bring a just peace, Moldovan President Maia Sandu said during a press conference with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

Title: Zelenskyy, Azerbaijani President discuss gas transportation issue...
Description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy discussed with Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev in Davos the issue of using Ukrainian infrastructure to transport Azerbaijani gas if Europe needs it.

Title: Zelenskyy, Sandu issue joint statement
Description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and Moldovan President Maia Sandu issued a joint statement after talks in Kyiv, in which they noted the current aspects of bilateral and international cooperation between the two countries, the President's Office of Ukraine said on Saturday.

Title: USA does not suspend military aid to Ukraine – Zelenskyy
Description: The United States did not suspend military aid to Ukraine, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy commented on the signing by U.S. President Donald Trump of an executive order to suspend foreign aid programs for 90 days.

Title: Ukraine may send people to service power plant on left bank of Dn...
Description: Ukraine may send specialists to service Moldova State District Power Plant, which is located on the left bank of the Dniester, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said.

Title: Zelenskyy, Sandu discuss support for Ukraine, Moldova
Description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and Moldovan President Maia Sandu discussed support for Ukraine and Moldova during their talks in Kyiv.

Title: Zelenskyy, Sandu pledge to meet energy needs of Transnistria's re...
Description: President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyy and President of Moldova Maya Sandu issued a joint statement after the talks in Kyiv, in which, in particular, they condemned the termination of Russian gas supplies to Transnistria and confirmed the ability of the two countries to ensure the energy supply of the region, the President's Office of Ukraine said on Saturday.

Title: European Solidarity MPs petition for General Halushkin's release ...
Description: Co-chairman of the European Solidarity faction in the Verkhovna Rada Artur Herasymov, and the MPs of the same faction, Maksym Savrasov, Mykhailo Bondar and Mykola Velychkovych, announced their readiness to take on bail the brigadier general, former commander of the Kharkiv operational-tactical group of forces Yuriy Halushkin, it was reported on the European Solidarity's website on Friday.

Title: Moscow's goodwill can be generated by superior firepower and crus...
Description: The policy of escalation management and appeasement do not work in relations with Russia; only economic and military pressure can force the aggressor to peace, Ukrainian Foreign Minister Andriy Sybiha believes.

Title: In Ukraine, 2 guided air missiles, 46 enemy UAVs shot
Description: On the night of January 25, 2025 (from 19:00 on January 24), the Russians attacked Ukraine with two Kh-59/69 guided air missiles from the airspace of the Black Sea and 61 Shahed-type strike UAVs and various types of drone imitators from the directions of Orel, Kursk, Bryansk, Millerovo, Primorsko-Akhtarsk (Russia), the Ukrainian Air Force said.

Title: General Staff reports 211 combat clashes in 24 hours
Description: Over the past 24 hours, some 211 combat clashes have been recorded. This was reported by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine in Telegram in operational information on the Russian invasion as of 08:00 Saturday.

Title: Rada Committee on National Security: Arrests of military commande...
Description: Statements and actions during the war that could lead to the discrediting of the Armed Forces of Ukraine threaten the unity of the Ukrainian people and the defense capability of the country, according to a statement by the Verkhovna Rada Committee on National Security, as reported by committee member Iryna Friz (from the European Solidarity faction).

Title: Russians can transfer terror to any other country at any time – Z...
Description: Russians can transfer terror to any other country at any time, different countries are already seeing incidents with drones on their territory, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said.

Title: Nine-story building in one of Kyiv region's towns was partially d...
Description: A nine-story residential building was partially destroyed as a result of an enemy attack in one of the settlements of Kyiv region, the acting chairman of Kyiv Regional State Administration Mykola Kalashnyk said in his Telegram channel.

Title: European Solidarity MPs petition for General Halushkin's release ...
Description: Co-chairman of the European Solidarity faction in the Verkhovna Rada Artur Herasymov, and the MPs of the same faction, Maksym Savrasov, Mykhailo Bondar and Mykola Velychkovych, announced their readiness to take on bail the brigadier general, former commander of the Kharkiv operational-tactical group of forces Yuriy Halushkin, it was reported on the European Solidarity's website on Friday.

Title: Sandu arrives in Kyiv for talks with Zelenskyy
Description: Moldovan President Maia Sandu is in Kyiv for talks with her Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelensky.

Title: MFA denies Fico's accusations of Ukraine's alleged involvement in...
Description: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine has denied accusations by Slovakian Prime Minister Robert Fico of Ukraine's alleged involvement in the cyberattack against a Slovak insurance company.

Title: High Anti-Corruption Court sets UAH 100 mln bail for MP Viktor Bo...
Description: The High Anti-Corruption Court (HACC) has imposed a UAH 100 million bail as an alternative to detention for a sitting member of parliament accused of embezzling over UAH 140 million in procurement contracts for Ukrzaliznytsia (Ukrainian Railways).

Title: EU High Representative: Our priority is to strengthen Ukraine's p...
Description: The EU wants peace for Ukraine, but it needs to be sustainable, EU High Representative Kaja Kallas said.

Title: AFU General Staff: 46 enemy attacks recorded in Pokrovsk axis, 30...
Description: Since the beginning of the day and as of 16:00, some 117 combat clashes have been recorded along the entire front line, 46 of them in Pokrovsk axis, the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine said on Friday.

Title: Architects of Ukraine, Denmark develop manual on democratic resto...
Description: The National Union of Architects of Ukraine and the Danish Association of Architects have developed and are presenting the manual titled 'Democratic Restoration of Ukraine.'

Title: Ukrnafta plans to build 370 MW of power generation capacity using...
Description: PJSC Ukrnafta is working on energy generation projects using its own gas, with a total planned capacity of up to 370 MW.

Title: Cabinet approves draft agreement with Poland on cooperation in co...
Description: The draft agreement between the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine and the Government of the Republic of Poland on cooperation in combating crime was approved at a meeting of the Ukrainian government on Friday, representative of the Cabinet of Ministers in the Verkhovna Rada Taras Melnychuk said.

Title: MIHR investigation into crash of Il-76 over Belgorod: Fact of POW...
Description: The fact of Ukrainian prisoners of war (POWs) being on board the Il-76 aircraft that crashed in Belgorod region in January 2024 remains unconfirmed, according to the results of an investigation by the Media Initiative for Human Rights (MIHR).

Title: Kyivstar wants to buy taxi service Uklon
Description: Mobile operator Kyivstar wants to buy online taxi service Uklon, the corresponding applications for the acquisition of Ukrainian Tech Uklon LLC, Uklon Corporate LLC, Uklon Ukraine LLC and Cypriot UKLON Ltd by the mobile operator were received by the Antimonopoly Committee of Ukraine (AMCU) in December 2024.

Title: Defense Ministry does not extend contract with Bezrukova, motion ...
Description: Ukrainian Defense Minister Rustem Umerov announced that the contract with Marнna Bezrukova, who headed the Defense Procurement Agency, will not be extended, and also announced the dismissal of his deputy Dmytro Klymenkov.

Title: Ukraine aims to restore 3 GW of damaged generation in 2025, addin...
Description: Ukrainian energy companies plan to restore 3 GW of power generation capacity damaged by Russian attacks in 2025, Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal announced on Telegram.

Title: Interfax-Ukraine to host press conference 'Private medicine in Uk...
Description: (Participants list has been updated)

Title: Yermak: Putin seeks to talk about Ukraine without Ukraine, this n...
Description: Vladimir Putin is trying to promote the idea of ​​​​negotiations with the United States, but seeks to talk about Ukraine without Ukraine's participation, this will not happen, Head of the President's Office Andriy Yermak said.

Title: On January 31, Kyiv will host a forum for agribusiness managers
Interfax-Ukraine to host press conference 'Private medicine in Uk...
Description: On Thursday, January 30, at 12.00, the press center of the Interfax-Ukraine News Agency will host a press conference titled 'Private medicine in Ukraine: Three years of war and further challenges.' Participants include Director of Smart Medical Center, Chairman of the Association of Private Healthcare Institutions of Ukraine Olena Yeschenko; Deputy General Director of Synevo Ukraine Mykola Skavronsky; Medical Director of the Dobrobut healthcare network Oleksandra Mashkevych; Operational Director of Leleka maternity hospital Vadym Zukin; Director of Aneli Medical and Diagnostic Center Olena Afanasieva; Director of Garvis health center Vitaliy Bereznytsky (online); Medical Director of Odrex health center Dmytro Havrychenko (online) (8/5a Reitarska Street). The event will be streamed the Interfax-Ukraine YouTube channel. Admission requires registration on the spot with press ID cards.

Title: War in Ukraine approaching 'turning point,' Turkey ready to suppo...
Description: The Russian war against Ukraine is approaching a 'turning point,' Turkey is ready to support initiatives to resume the peace negotiations, Turkish Foreign Minister Hakan Fidan has said.

Title: European Commission sends Council first screening report within E...
Description: The European Commission sent the first screening report Cluster 1 Fundamentals for Ukraine to the European Council for the further discussion with Member States.

Title: Former command of 155th Anne de Kyiv Brigade put draft dodgers on...
Description: The former command of the 155th Separate Mechanized Brigade assisted draft dodgers in crossing the state border under the pretense of being Ukrainian soldiers traveling for military training in France, Adviser to the State Bureau of Investigations (SBI) Tetiana Sapyan said on Friday.

Title: Female Veterans: Adaptation Through Lens of Gender Needs
Description: As Ukraine enters the third year of russia's full-scale invasion, the number of demobilized soldiers continues to rise. Currently, there is a lack of government programs specifically targeting the needs of women returning from the army, despite their growing presence in the Armed Forces. Approaches to social and psychological reintegration are universal and fail to address the unique challenges women face when adapting to civilian life. These difficulties are driven by differences in societal expectations, gender roles and the distinct experiences gained during and after the war.

Title: Bodies of 757 fallen defenders repatriated to Ukraine – Coordinat...
Description: The bodies of 757 fallen defenders have been repatriated to Ukraine, the Coordination Headquarters for the Treatment of Prisoners of War said on Friday.

Title: Sybiha: With lower oil prices, higher sanctions pressure, Russian...
Description: The lower the oil prices and the higher the sanctions pressure, the less fuel for the war machine in Moscow, Minister of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine Andriy Sybiha has said Friday.

Title: Ukraine's MFA about Russia's ultimatum to NATO: Utter bullshit
Description: Spokesperson for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine Heorhiy Tykhy has retorted sharply to Russia's ultimatum that one of the key elements for ending the war was to cancel NATO's promise of Ukraine's future membership, made at the 2008 Bucharest summit.

Title: DTEK ready to help Moldova ensure energy stability - CEO
Description: DTEK energy holding is ready to help Moldova ensure its energy stability, said its CEO Maksym Timchenko following a meeting with Moldovan Prime Minister Dorin Recean on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum in Davos.

Title: Stefanchuk welcomes Luxembourg Parliament resolution on human rig...
Description: The resolution of the Luxembourg Parliament condemning Russia for human rights violations against Crimean Tatars during the illegal occupation of Crimea is an important step towards holding those responsible accountable, says Verkhovna Rada Chairman Ruslan Stefanchuk.

Title: Interfax-Ukraine to host briefing 'Improving palliative care at p...
Description: On Wednesday, January 29, at 15.00, the press center of the Interfax-Ukraine News Agency will host a briefing on the results of the program 'Strengthening the capacity of primary health care institutions to provide palliative care in Chernihiv, Sumy and Dnipropetrovsk regions,' implemented within the project Support for Health Care Reform.

Title: Defense forces destroy 25 enemy UAVs – Ukraine's Air Force
Description: On the night of January 24, Russian occupiers attacked the territory of Ukraine with 58 Shahed-type attack UAVs and drone imitators of various types, the Air Force command of the Armed Forces of Ukraine reports.

Title: Ukraine's General Staff confirms strikes on Ryazan Oil Refinery, ...
Description: The Security Service of Ukraine and the Special Operations Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine conducted a joint operation on the night of January 24, 2025, striking objects involved in providing support to the Russian occupation army.

Title: Zelenskyy appoints Olha Kuryshko as permanent presidential rep in...
Description: President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyy dismissed Olha Kuryshko from the post of deputy representative of the president in Crimea and appointed her to the post of permanent representative in the Autonomous Republic of Crimea.

Title: Interpipe invests total of $83 mln in improving product quality, ...
Description: The Ukrainian industrial company Interpipe has invested $83 million in improving product quality and new production lines in almost three years of the full-scale war.

Title: For Ukraine, OECD membership no less important than EU, NATO one ...
Description: Ukraine is determined to move forward on the path of implementing reforms to gain membership in the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD), which is no less important than NATO and EU membership, said Deputy Head of the President's Office Ihor Zhovkva during a meeting with OECD Director for Eurasian Affairs William Thomson.

Title: Europe expects USA to provide troops for peacekeeping mission in ...
Description: European officials are seeking commitments from the new administration of US President Donald Trump to participate in security guarantees for Ukraine, including in the format of peacekeeping troops, Bloomberg reports.

Title: Zelenskyy on shelling of Kyiv region: Russia would not be able to...
Description: Russia would not have been able to fight if the ability of Russian allies to help this terror had been really limited, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy responded to the night shelling of Kyiv region.

Title: Kremniy plant in Bryansk attacked by drones for third time - CCD
Description: In the Russian city of Bryansk, the Kremniy plant has been attacked by drones for the third time. It produces microelectronics for missile systems and other military equipment, in particular for Iskanders and drones, said Andriy Kovalenko, head of the Center for Countering Disinformation (CCD) of the National Security and Defense Council.

Title: Ukraine welcomes decisions of Syrian authorities aimed at refusin...
Description: Ukraine welcomes the cancellation by the Syrian authorities of the investment agreement with the Russian side on Russia's use of the seaport of Tartus.

Title: Syrsky: We need to prepare not only for defense, but also for off...
Description: The Kursk operation significantly motivated both the personnel of the Armed Forces of Ukraine (AFU) and society, and it will not be the last, said Oleksandr Syrsky, Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.

Title: We’ll work on other govt programs, now it’s important to support ...
Description: More than 12 million Ukrainians have applied under the e-Support program, and work will be carried out on other government programs, President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said following a report by Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal.

Title: Zelenskyy announces coordination of intl work
Description: President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyy held meetings on Thursday and reported on the coordination of international work, primarily in the United States and Europe.

Title: Yermak-McFaul group supports Trump's desire to lower oil prices
Description: Yermak-McFaul sanctions group supports U.S. President Donald Trump's desire to lower oil prices, since then Russia will not be able to finance the war, Head of the President's Office of Ukraine Andriy Yermak said.

Title: Trump hopes China will help him end the war in Ukraine
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump has said that he always liked Chinese President Xi Jinping, and expressed hope for China's help in the peaceful settlement of Russia's war against Ukraine.
